snippet: President Petro O. Poroshenko’s peace plan, which includes “decentralization” measures, came after a phone call with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.
abstract: Pro-Russian militants rule out plan by Ukraine's new president, Petro O Poroshenko, to soon order temporary, unilateral cease-fire as part of a broader 14-point peace plan; most reject idea of disarming until a patchwork of amorphous conditions are met, suggesting that a truce would be difficult to achieve.

byline.original: By ANDREW ROTH and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
byline.contributor: Andrew Roth reported from Donetsk, and David M. Herszenhorn from Moscow. Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: President Petro O. Poroshenko’s peace plan, which includes “decentralization” measures, came after a phone call with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

headline.main: Rebels Reject Ukrainian Leader’s Cease-Fire Idea
headline.print_headline: Rebels Reject Ukrainian Leader’s Cease-Fire Idea
